acceptance_criteria: - runtime debug flow documented and aligned with design expectations; - opt-in/disable behavior verified in tests; - no regression to existing debug/viz transport paths.

comments.author: Hailey Collet

title: Visualizer: implement Neural Activity View per NBNv2 design plan
description:
Build out the Visualizer Neural Activity View from placeholder to functional view aligned with NBNv2 design/architecture docs.

Scope (broad):
- Define and implement rendering model for neuron/edge activity and tick correlation
- Integrate region focus/zoom and filtering semantics with live streams
- Establish performance strategy for large brain/region views (sampling, culling, paging)
- Add interaction model (selection, hover details, navigation) and state sync with Brain selection
- Add tests for rendering state transforms and key interaction flows
- Document UX/ops behavior and limits
close_reason: Parent feature complete; all scoped child tasks closed and validated.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text:
Groundwork pass completed: introduced a Visualizer activity projection scaffold (region/edge/tick summaries + stats), wired it into VizPanelViewModel with options (tick window, low-signal filtering, region focus), and replaced placeholder-only panel markup with a structured scaffold view + stream inspection surface.

Implementation slices planned from here:
1) Canvas renderer + layout engine for node/edge/tick overlays
2) Interaction model (selection/hover/pin/navigation) with detail panes
3) Performance path (sampling, culling, tick-window virtualization, backpressure UX)
4) Visualizer-specific tests and UX/operator docs for limits and behavior

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Delivered interaction slice: canvas select/hover/pin/navigation plus interaction summaries and keyboard shortcuts. Also extended layout tests for interaction-state rendering. NBNv2-547.1 closed; NBNv2-547.2 in_progress for docs + broader test surface.

title: Visualizer: add activity interaction model (select/hover/pin/navigation)

Input vector field now auto-suggests a sized sequence matching input width from BrainInfo.

Added/updated tests in VizPanelViewModelInteractionTests, including overlapping node/edge sticky-edge precedence coverage.

title: Visualizer: implement neural activity canvas renderer + layout engine
description: Build actual Neural Activity canvas rendering on top of the new projection scaffold (region/edge/tick summaries). Include deterministic layout contracts, node/edge draw primitives, region focus anchoring, and tick-correlated visual states.
notes: Regression fix: removed projection row caps from canvas source data (regions/edges no longer truncated to top-N), so full-brain node/edge maps include complete in-window coverage. Snapshot side panel remains intentionally capped in VM for readability.
close_reason: Completed implementation

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Addressed no-canvas rendering report: projection no longer culls edge rows by FocusRegionId, and Visualizer default focus now starts as full-brain (blank focus). Added explicit 'Full brain' reset control in Viz panel to clear focus/filter quickly.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Follow-up fix for empty edge visualization: RegionShard now emits route-addressed VizAxonSent events per outbox destination (source/target Address32 populated), replacing aggregate axon event-only emission. This enables projection edge route construction under live streams.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Patched VizPanel canvas layering to avoid zero-sized ItemsControl render layers (moved to fixed-size grid overlay, explicit node container placement), added copyable legend/interaction/pinned text, and moved snapshot toggle to upper-right outside the canvas area. Added Ctrl+Shift+C diagnostics copy to clipboard with payload fallback.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Implemented visualizer render/state refactor: decoupled interaction redraw from projection rebuild (hover/click stability), added persistent per-brain topology memory for regions/routes/neuron addresses, and introduced dual canvas modes (full-brain region graph + focused-region neuron/gateway graph with direction-aware edge colors and dormant topology visibility).

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Implemented definition-backed topology hydration path in Workbench Visualizer: on brain select/focus, it now requests ExportBrainDefinition (fallback BrainInfo.BaseDefinition), loads .nbn from artifact store, and seeds full region/route topology without waiting for stream activity. Added runtime support in HiveMind for ExportBrainDefinition/RequestSnapshot responses via IoGateway forwarding. Full-brain view can now render structural routes from definition data, and focused region mode can preload neuron/axon topology touching the focus region.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Crash hotfix: Workbench launch failure fixed by guarding VizActivityCanvasLayoutBuilder.BuildRegionEdges against empty aggregate sets. Startup path can now render region nodes with zero routes without throwing. Added regression test Build_DoesNotThrow_WhenRegionNodesExistWithoutAnyRoutes.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Follow-up interaction/topology pass: improved edge direction visibility (thicker direction border + dash line types), split hover handling to avoid canvas re-render flicker, added tap handlers for node/edge selection, and expanded definition artifact root discovery to include per-brain subdirectories so focus mode can hydrate neuron/axon topology beyond activity stream-only nodes.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Added definition-reference propagation for Visualizer topology hydration: BrainHost now accepts/registers nbn/nbs artifact refs (--nbn-sha256/--nbn-size/--artifact-store-uri), Designer and Orchestrator now pass those args when launching BrainHost, and IoGateway now serves ExportBrainDefinition/RequestSnapshot directly from its registered brain metadata (with HiveMind fallback + cache update). Added integration tests for IoGateway export/snapshot local metadata responses. Note: brains already running without BaseDefinition metadata still report source=none until re-registered or respawned.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Improved Visualizer interaction + stability: replaced per-item hover/click with canvas-level hit resolution, added persistent hover detail card near pointer (copyable text), widened edge hit-test stroke, and included hover summaries with event/tick values. Fixed UI lock/crash path by bounding visualizer event flush work per UI dispatch pass (MaxEventsPerUiFlush=256) instead of unbounded while-loop on UI thread. Added layout tests for dense focus-mode graphs and hit-test thickness assertions.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Added tick-aware render coalescing in VizPanel: streaming refresh now runs at most on cadence and only when a new tick is observed for the current selection (with forced render on queue drain), reducing dense-focus relayout pressure. Reduced per-dispatch stream batch size to 96 events. Also lowered local Workbench HiveMind launch defaults to --tick-hz 8 --min-tick-hz 2 as temporary safety baseline.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Addressed remaining high-CPU/freeze symptoms in focused region view: (1) focused edge renderer now collapses gateway fan-out routes by displayed endpoints (e.g., repeated N0->R8 merges into one visual edge), cutting edge count and hit-test load; (2) stream queue now drops oldest pending events above cap (1600) and schedules continuation at Dispatcher background priority; (3) streaming tick gating now uses focus-aware tick detection (events touching focus region only) so unrelated brain activity no longer forces full focused-canvas rebuilds.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Workbench integration now drives runtime viz scope (not just hub subscription): Shell updates active visualization brain + optional focus region from current Visualizer state, and WorkbenchClient sends SetBrainVisualization to HiveMind. This keeps behavior generic for any future client and aligns visual stream production with selected brain/view scope.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Fix pass for missing topology in full-brain/focus views: added definition-hydration request dedupe and periodic retry trigger from refresh flow, so large graph structure repopulates even if initial artifact lookup misses. Also expanded artifact root probing (repo artifacts, demo paths, current/base directories) to improve definition discovery across launch modes.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Completed runtime/workbench fixes for visualizer regression + controls: fixed focus/full definition topology coverage gating (added full-topology coverage flag + SHA reset path), added HiveMind tick-rate temporary override protocol + handling, and surfaced override controls in Visualizer (apply/clear). Added HiveMind and proto compatibility tests; release build/test green (106 passed).

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text:
User-directed closure: scope appears complete and implemented across runtime + Workbench, with prior comments documenting shipped behavior and tests.
Closing this task and tracking remaining Visualizer work under sibling issues.

title: Visualizer: performance pipeline for large brains (sampling/culling/windowing)
description: Implement scalable rendering/data pipeline for large activity volumes: adaptive sampling, edge/node culling, tick-window virtualization, and guardrails for UI responsiveness under sustained event rates.
notes: Completed child tasks NBNv2-547.4.4 and NBNv2-547.4.6 in this session with tests and quality gates green.
close_reason: All child tasks completed; visualizer performance pipeline delivered and validated.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Implemented runtime-controlled visualization emission gating: added generic control-plane messages SetBrainVisualization and UpdateShardVisualization, wired HiveMind to propagate enable/disable + optional focus region scope to shards, and gated RegionShard viz emission accordingly. This reduces actor traffic when Visualizer is inactive and allows region-scoped emission in focused view.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Perf-adjacent interaction refinement: reduced unnecessary hover state churn by adding hover sample stabilization in VizPanel pointer handling and prioritizing sticky hover resolution before full hit scans in VizPanelViewModel. This lowers relayout/summary churn under dense canvas hover jitter while preserving selection semantics.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Addressed current Visualizer regressions: (1) constrained region/node/edge layout to keep full-brain content in view bounds, (2) extended focus-mode gateway tooltip details with aggregate region metrics parity, and (3) enabled horizontal scrolling fallback in VizPanel. Added focused tests in VizActivityCanvasLayoutBuilderTests; full Release test gate passes.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Visualizer interaction/layout follow-up: stabilized hover persistence (longer clear delay + stronger sticky tolerances + deterministic hit tie-breaks), shifted edge endpoints/loops outside node bodies to improve readability/hitability, fixed node radius jitter by stabilizing diameters, and changed buffer tooltip formatting to report avg/latest as n/a when buffer samples are absent. Added regression tests for endpoint/loop geometry, no-buffer formatting, and stable region node diameter.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Visualizer semantics pass: added color-mode selector (State priority, Activity priority, Topology reference) with in-panel hint/legend text; base fill can now prioritize signed value using colorblind-safe blue/orange diverging mapping, while activity remains in pulse/opacity and topology in border. Also updated value metrics to aggregate from axon+fired+buffer events (not buffer-only), tightened self-loop geometry, and increased hover retention to reduce tooltip flicker/dropouts.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Follow-up UX tuning after user validation: reduced hover over-stickiness (shorter clear delay, smaller sticky paddings, no unconditional keep-alive on pointer move, smarter pointer-exit retention), fixed options-row overlap by widening control columns, wrapped legend text, and moved horizontal scrolling from page-level to canvas-only ScrollViewer to remove whole-page left/right jitter.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Hover over-stickiness follow-up: adjusted VizPanel hover stabilization so no-hit samples schedule deferred clear instead of repeatedly forcing keep-alive. Also gated keep-alive during throttled pointer moves behind retention distance. This fixes tooltip persistence when pointer moves off target and then stops, while preserving sticky switch behavior.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Adjusted full-brain region layout to reduce one-dimensional horizontal sprawl: compressed axial x-span, added deterministic slice undulation, and increased center-mass-biased in-slice spread so axial layers remain readable without nodes hugging canvas extremes. Added regression tests for vertical spread across slices and compact horizontal span.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Focused-region dense layout + hover follow-up: replaced single-ring focus neuron placement with bounded concentric packing to avoid node overlap in high-neuron regions, with spacing/ring-gap safeguards when nearing orbit limits. Also split hover hit-testing from click hit-testing (stricter hover thresholds/sticky tolerance, click remains forgiving) to prevent tooltip persistence when pointer is off-target. Added regression tests for dense focus non-overlap and hover-vs-click strictness.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Completed remaining performance-pipeline children: (1) replaced canvas edge/node ItemsControls with retained single draw surface (VizActivityCanvasSurface), (2) moved projection+layout synthesis off UI thread with versioned async snapshot apply in VizPanelViewModel, (3) retained typed edge-curve caching and removed PathData regeneration during canvas normalization, (4) added adaptive focus-mode LOD budgets by zoom+density with user toggles and disable path, and (5) added optional projected-3D region layout mode with explicit focus-mode fallback + guardrails doc at tools/Nbn.Tools.Workbench/docs/viz-3d-layout-rd.md. Added focused regression tests in VizActivityCanvasLayoutBuilderTests and validated full gate via dotnet build/test -c Release --disable-build-servers.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Post-close regression fix: restored node label/star glyph rendering on VizActivityCanvasSurface and widened fit-view bounds heuristics in VizPanel (label-aware + larger padding) so fit view frames full rendered content.

title: Visualizer perf: replace edge/node ItemsControls with single draw surface
description: Current canvas renders many per-item visuals (multiple Paths per edge). Replace with a custom draw surface that renders edges/nodes in one pass with retained draw resources.
acceptance_criteria: R24-like cases (>=40 neurons, >=350 routes) remain interactive without lockups; canvas visual tree node count reduced materially from baseline.
close_reason: Implemented and verified in Release build/test gate.

title: Visualizer R&D: optional 3D region layout using distance-model coordinates
description: Investigate and prototype a toggleable 3D region layout mode that uses NBN region-distance semantics to position regions, with graceful fallback to 2D when performance is insufficient.
acceptance_criteria: Prototype defines region coordinate mapping that respects NBN axial distance model constraints; Rendering path includes explicit perf guardrails and fallback behavior to maintain smooth interaction; Interaction model (hover/select/pin/tooltips) remains coherent in 3D mode; Document tradeoffs and go/no-go criteria for productionizing 3D mode; dotnet build/test Release with disabled build servers remains green.
close_reason: Implemented and verified in Release build/test gate.

title: Visualizer follow-up: tooltip release and node-first hit precedence
description: Address remaining hover-targeting regressions in Visualizer interaction: tooltip can remain visible after pointer leaves all targets/off-canvas, and edge hit resolution can still win in ambiguous zones where pointer is clearly inside a node. Scope this issue to tooltip lifecycle and deterministic target precedence only.
acceptance_criteria: 1) Hover tooltip clears after leaving all targets/off-canvas (no target switch required), with bounded delay and no permanent persistence. 2) If pointer is inside a node circle, node must always win hover and click target resolution over edges. 3) Keep click usability forgiving, but hover hit path should not cling off-target. 4) Add/adjust regression tests for hover clear behavior and node-over-edge precedence; Release build/test passes.
close_reason: Completed implementation and regression coverage; Release tests pass.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Layout-related follow-up split out to NBNv2-547.4.12 so this issue stays focused on tooltip release + node-first target precedence.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Implemented node-inside-circle precedence over sticky edges for click+hover resolution, changed retained no-hit hover path to arm deferred clear, added/updated Viz interaction regressions for node-over-edge precedence and hover clear behavior, and updated NBNv2_Design.md Aleph reliability guidance (codex executable/API prerequisites). Verified with dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Post-close follow-up after user validation: fixed throttled pointer-move hover lifecycle in VizPanel so keep-alive now requires a real current hover hit; if none is found, deferred clear is armed. This prevents tooltip persistence when pointer drifts off-target without triggering a full hover sample. Verified with dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Second follow-up after user repro: tightened hover probing to center-point only in VizPanel pointer hover path (removed hover near-miss probe offsets) so hover no longer latches via adjacent probe hits when pointer is off-target. Click probing remains unchanged/forgiving. Verified with dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Third follow-up after continued repro: made no-hit hover clear deterministic/immediate in VizPanel pointer handling (throttled move no-hit, pointer-exit, and no-hit hover resolution now call ClearCanvasHover directly), and reduced hover-clear sample gating to 1 to prevent indefinite defer re-arming while pointer is moving. Also increased whole-brain vertical region spread in BuildRegionPositions (larger slice wave + lane height scaling) per UX feedback.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Fourth follow-up after continued repro: removed hover pointer-move throttling in VizPanel (always resolves hover each move) to eliminate intermittent stale hover state that could survive throttle windows; hover clear remains deterministic immediate on no-hit paths. Also disabled horizontal scrollbar for viz canvas container and further compressed whole-brain horizontal spread while increasing effective vertical separation.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Fifth follow-up: added root-level pointer fallback handlers to clear hover whenever pointer is outside canvas bounds, while also keeping per-canvas move-based hover resolution unthrottled. This is intended to remove the remaining intermittent permanent tooltip cases. Also increased whole-brain vertical spacing again (larger slice wave/lane height) and further reduced horizontal spread.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Sixth follow-up after continued user repro: simplified VizPanel hover lifecycle to a single root pointer-move path that always resolves hover when pointer is inside ActivityCanvasSurface and clears immediately when pointer is outside canvas or exits panel. Removed per-canvas PointerMoved/PointerExited wiring to eliminate missed clear paths and stale hover retention. Also updated NBNv2_Design.md Aleph reliability notes with explicit codex/codex.cmd preflight and blocked-sub-query fallback guidance discovered in this session. Verified with dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers (120/120).

title: Visualizer layout follow-up: no-overlap guarantees and adaptive spacing
description: Address remaining layout clarity issues in full-brain and focus-region canvases: overlaps can still occur, dense regions need larger placement radii/separation, and edge radial spacing should increase when canvas room exists. Scope is layout/geometry only (separate from tooltip lifecycle).
acceptance_criteria: 1) Focus-region layout for dense neuron counts (>=40) increases placement radii and node spacing adaptively, with no node overlap at rendered diameters. 2) Whole-brain layout enforces non-overlap for region nodes under full 32-region population. 3) Edge radial spacing/arc separation expands when available room exists to improve readability without pushing nodes out of bounds. 4) Add/adjust regression tests for dense focus spacing, whole-brain overlap constraints, and edge separation behavior; Release build/test passes.
close_reason: Completed and user-validated

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Spawned from NBNv2-547.4.11 split request; tracks remaining layout/spacing/overlap work separately from tooltip lifecycle behavior.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Implemented focus-region radial spacing follow-up: increased concentric layer separation and allowed dense focus neuron layouts to extend beyond the visible canvas instead of compressing all layers to fit in-view. Added regression test Build_FocusModeDenseRegionUsesWiderRadialLayerSpacingWithoutForcingFullOnscreenFit plus full Release test gate pass (121/121).

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Follow-up on reported 41-neuron overlap case: made focus gateway orbit dynamic and explicitly outside neuron orbit (gateway min orbit is now derived from neuronMaxOrbit + clearance), increased dense-neuron overflow scaling and ring-gap parameters, and disabled canvas clamping for gateway ring placement in focus mode. Added regression test Build_FocusModeGatewayNodesRemainOutsideNeuronOrbitWithoutOverlap covering 41 neurons, 4 gateways, 385 routes plus outside-orbit and no-overlap assertions. Verified with dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers (122/122).

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Implemented canvas interaction controls while preserving default zoom scale: added on-canvas zoom/pan controls (+, -, fit, L/R/U/D), scrollable viewport extents, modifier input controls (Ctrl+Wheel zoom, Shift+Wheel horizontal pan, Shift+drag/middle-drag pan), and two-finger touch pinch/drag for zoom+pan. Added double-click behavior: empty canvas => Fit to View; region/gateway node => zoom focus to that region; neuron double-click remains normal selection (no special action). Also exposed public ZoomToRegion for code-behind-initiated focus changes. Verified with dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers (122/122).

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text:
Final validation pass complete with user acceptance ("Everything is great").
Follow-up fixes landed in commit e62273f for pan direction consistency, down-pan reliability, viewport height tuning, and navigation recenter hookups.
Release tests remain green via: dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers --artifacts-path .artifacts-temp (122/122).
Layout objectives for dense focus spacing, gateway outer orbit separation, and readability are now satisfied in current UX validation.

title: Visualizer perf: move projection/layout build off UI thread
description: Run projection and layout synthesis on a background worker and publish immutable snapshots to UI; keep UI thread for lightweight apply only.
acceptance_criteria: Projection/layout computation no longer blocks UI input; pointer/click/scroll stay responsive during sustained event ingress.
close_reason: Implemented and verified in Release build/test gate.

title: Visualizer perf: incremental keyed diff updates for canvas collections
description: Stop full clear/rebuild of CanvasNodes/CanvasEdges on refresh; apply keyed add/update/remove deltas so unchanged items are retained.
acceptance_criteria: No full collection reset when graph topology is unchanged; reduced allocations and smoother frame-to-frame updates.

title: Visualizer perf: spatial index + throttled hover hit-testing

close_reason: Implemented and verified in Release build/test gate.

title: Fix missing viz activity events (VizTick-only from region 0)
description:
Current reproducible bug (user retest on 2026-02-27):
- Brain spawn succeeds.
- Hosted workers are visible.
- Brain graph renders with expected nodes/edges.
- Visualization Stream emits only VIZ_TICK events, only from region 0.
- No neuron/axon activity events are observed in stream or visual activity overlay.

This issue is now scoped only to missing activity emission/propagation (not spawn visibility or graph structure).
acceptance_criteria:
1. In a fresh local Workbench run (new instance), spawn an activity-seeded random brain and subscribe to visualization.
2. Within 10 seconds, stream contains non-tick events (VIZ_NEURON_BUFFER and/or VIZ_NEURON_FIRED and/or VIZ_AXON_SENT).
3. Non-tick events are observed from at least one non-zero region (not region 0 only).
4. Brain visualization shows corresponding runtime activity (not tick-only heartbeat).
5. Evidence captured in latest Workbench logs for one passing run.
notes:
Trimmed scope: only the remaining VizTick-only activity-path failure.
Historical fixes (descriptor registration, subscriber cleanup, output width handling, etc.) are background context and are not active acceptance criteria for this issue.
Reproduction abort behavior is tracked separately and is out of scope here.

Added integration transport regression tests: RemoteDescriptorTransportTests.WorkerNodeRemote_Transports_VisualizationEvent_Messages and WorkerNodeRemote_Transports_DebugOutbound_Messages. Also fixed related export path timeout by adding nbn_io to HiveMindRemote (affects full-brain definition hydration). Waiting for user UI retest before closure.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Implemented multi-Workbench visualization subscription model and cleanup hardening. Key changes: (1) control.SetBrainVisualization now carries subscriber_actor; WorkbenchClient now always sends stable receiver PID identity, (2) HiveMind tracks per-brain subscriber preferences and computes effective scope (full-brain if any full-brain subscriber or conflicting focused regions; focused region only when all subscribers agree), (3) un/subscribing one client no longer disables visualization for other active subscribers, (4) cleanup path now includes death-watch handling + periodic sweep using SettingsMonitor NodeList (known node addresses that are no longer alive) + local process-registry liveness fallback for local subscribers, (5) docs updated to canonize Observability as shared core service with single DebugHub/VisualizationHub per deployment. Added/updated tests in HiveMindOutputSinkTests for multi-subscriber disable isolation, conflicting focus fallback, deterministic terminated cleanup, and real stop-based cleanup reliability. Validation: dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers --filter FullyQualifiedName~HiveMindOutputSinkTests|FullyQualifiedName~ConnectionViewModelTests|FullyQualifiedName~OrchestratorPanelViewModelTests|FullyQualifiedName~RemoteDescriptorTransportTests => Passed 32/32.

HiveMind now requests SettingsMonitor NodeList alongside worker inventory refresh and tracks known/active node addresses; sweep removes subscriber leases tied to known cluster node addresses that are no longer alive. Added local-process liveness sweep fallback via ActorSystem.ProcessRegistry lookup for likely-local subscriber PIDs, so stop/disconnect cleanup does not depend solely on death-watch timing. Added tests: SetBrainVisualization_TerminatedSubscriberMessage_RemovesOnlyTargetedSubscriber and SetBrainVisualization_StoppedLocalSubscriber_IsEventuallyCleanedUp (no skips).

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Current root-cause pass (2026-02-27): pulled latest %LOCALAPPDATA%/Nbn.Workbench/logs from user retest; logs were startup+spawn only (no payload-level viz/output lines). Reproduced with controlled probe on fresh local stack using DemoHost observe-activity while services remained alive: brain 1d331cbd-9166-49ec-b639-06738d494458 over 10s => viz.total=300, viz.non_tick=0, viz.types={VizTick:300}, viz.regions=[0], output_vectors.total=300, all_zero=300, non_zero=0. This confirms subscription path can deliver events but only tick events are emitted; shard activity remains absent/quiescent. Implemented follow-up fixes: (1) routable subscriber_actor formatting now uses system-address fallback in WorkbenchReceiverActor and DemoHost ActivityProbe (prevents local-id-only subscriber routing); (2) random brain generation now seeds a baseline activity path to output (driver neuron ACT_ADD with strong output edge + output neuron low thresholds) to avoid fresh random brains booting quiescent with all-zero vectors/viz-tick-only streams. Targeted validation passed (50 tests): DesignerPanelRandomBrainTests + ProtoCompatibilityTests + OutputCoordinatorActorTests + VizPanelViewModelInteractionTests.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Latest attempt (2026-02-27): instrumented tick barrier + shard viz and confirmed first drop was compute-side no-firing (not barrier/subscription). RegionShard showed vizEnabled=true but axonEvents=0/firedEvents=0 while output vectors stayed all-zero. Root cause found in random-brain baseline seeding: seeded driver could land in input region, then IO function normalization removed driver semantics, leaving structurally valid but quiescent brains. Runtime fix applied in DesignerPanelViewModel.EnsureBaselineActivityPath to always seed driver in non-input/non-output region, with fallback non-IO neuron creation when needed. Added regression test NewRandomBrain_AlwaysSeedsBaselineDriverOutsideInputRegion (seed sweep) and focused integration test DemoStyle_InputVector_Produces_VisualizationActivity asserting non-VizTick activity within bounded ticks. Targeted suites now pass; awaiting fresh user retest in new Workbench instance to confirm live visualization shows non-tick neuron/axon activity.

Also avoids clobbering stored artifacts with empty refs on termination.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Added stale termination suppression for respawn safety: BrainIoEntry now tracks RegisteredAtMs and IoGateway ignores BrainTerminated messages older than the current entry registration timestamp, preventing delayed old-epoch termination from removing a newly respawned same-ID brain.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Improved termination payload parity across all reasons: IoGateway now uses local runtime energy/tick-cost when constructing BrainTerminated broadcasts (not only energy_exhausted), so operator/External World consumers receive authoritative values whenever the IO entry exists.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Hardened same-ID re-register ordering in IoGateway: when RegisterBrain includes EnergyState, IO now treats it as authoritative epoch refresh by resetting depletion latch + tick-cost dedupe watermark and refreshing registration timestamp. This prevents prior-epoch stale termination/cost state from leaking into the re-registered brain entry.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Added ordering parity guardrail for config-only re-registers: verified that HasRuntimeConfig-only RegisterBrain sync does not reset lifecycle epoch timestamp, so in-flight termination for the current epoch is still honored and brain is removed.

title: Fix spawn regression where brain pauses then disappears after successful spawn
description:
Regression after recent WIP changes: in Workbench Designer, random brain spawn now returns success and a BrainId, briefly appears in Visualizer Known Brains as Paused, then disappears.

Current run evidence (2026-02-26 UTC):
- BrainId: 3bb52932-83fb-4600-9c2f-1eeee7345236
- HiveMind logs show placement accepted (workers=1), then repeated TickCompute/TickDeliver timeouts, then global pause:
  - TickCompute timeout tick 275 pending=1
  - TickDeliver timeout tick 275 pendingBrains=3bb5...
  - repeated through ticks 276-280
  - Paused all brains: tick 280 timed out (pause after 6 timeouts)
- WorkerNode log has only startup lines (no shard/compute completion logging), suggesting either compute completion acks are not emitted, not correlated, or being dropped/ignored upstream.

Already implemented in this session:
1) Removed Designer post-spawn explicit placement request to avoid double-placement churn.
   - tools/Nbn.Tools.Workbench/ViewModels/DesignerPanelViewModel.cs
2) Settings DB default path moved to per-machine LocalApplicationData with CLI override retained.
   - src/Nbn.Runtime.SettingsMonitor/SettingsMonitorOptions.cs
   - tools/Nbn.Tools.Workbench/ViewModels/ConnectionViewModel.cs
   - tools/Nbn.Tools.Workbench/ViewModels/OrchestratorPanelViewModel.cs
   - Linux included via Environment.SpecialFolder.LocalApplicationData fallback semantics.
3) Tests updated/added for the above behavior changes.

Current hypothesis:
- Spawn/placement now succeeds, but tick completion barrier accounting is not receiving or not matching RegionShard completions for newly assigned shards, causing deterministic timeout -> pause.
- Secondary symptom: Known Brains list eventually drops the paused brain, potentially due to unregister/state sync gap after timeout-driven pause/failure path.

Next debug/implementation plan:
1) Trace TickComputeDone/TickDeliverDone send path from RegionShard/WorkerNode to HiveMind and verify sender/request semantics and IDs (brain/region/shard/tick).
2) Audit HiveMind pending barrier keying and matching logic during mid-compute shard registration transitions.
3) Add targeted logging around pending set mutations and done-message matching decisions.
4) Patch matching/registration race and add focused tests for spawn + first ticks + no false timeout under single-worker local launch.
5) Validate from Workbench end-to-end: spawned brain stays present and does not auto-pause/disappear.
acceptance_criteria:
1) Fresh local launch: Designer random brain spawn remains present in Known Brains for at least 60s without automatic pause/disappearance.
2) HiveMind no longer times out ticks solely due to newly registered shards during normal spawn path.
3) New/updated tests cover the fixed barrier/ack matching behavior and fail on the pre-fix regression.
4) Workbench/Settings default DB behavior remains LocalApplicationData-based (Windows/Linux) with explicit --db override preserved.
close_reason: Spawn regression resolved; remaining visualizer/reproduction problems tracked separately in NBNv2-bje and NBNv2-776.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text:
Update (2026-02-26):
- Implemented runtime fix in HiveMind tick barrier sender validation:
  - TickComputeDone and TickDeliverDone now accept either:
    1) expected tracked sender (existing strict path), or
    2) trusted brain controller sender (BrainRoot/SignalRouter) as fallback.
- Rationale: in some startup/discovery/orderings, completion messages can be forwarded via controller path, and strict shard-only sender match causes false pending barriers -> compute/deliver timeouts -> global pause.

Code/tests added:
- src/Nbn.Runtime.HiveMind/HiveMindActor.cs

Operational note:

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text:
Update (2026-02-26, drain-wedge mitigation pass)

Implemented additional runtime mitigation for repeated deliver timeouts when input drain replies stop arriving:

Code change:
- src/Nbn.Runtime.Brain/BrainSignalRouterActor.cs
  - In ExpirePendingInputDrains(...), after expiring stale drain state, router now clears cached `_ioGatewayPid`.
  - Rationale: repeated drain-expiry indicates stale/unreachable IO gateway PID; clearing it prevents the router from re-entering the same drain wait loop every tick.
  - Resulting behavior: first affected tick may still timeout upstream, but subsequent ticks proceed without repeated drain waits until IO gateway is re-captured via sender or RegisterIoGateway.
  - Log now includes `ioGatewayCleared=true` on drain-expiry events.

Regression test added:
- tests/Nbn.Tests/Brain/BrainSignalRouterInputDrainTests.cs
  - TickDeliver_MissingInputDrain_DoesNotWedge_SubsequentTicks
  - Simulates a silent IO gateway (DrainInputs request never answered), verifies tick 2 and tick 3 still complete after tick 1 becomes stale/expired, proving no repeated per-tick wedge.

Validation run:
- dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers tests/Nbn.Tests/Nbn.Tests.csproj --filter FullyQualifiedName~BrainSignalRouterInputDrainTests --artifacts-path .artifacts-temp
  - Passed 8/8
- dotnet test -c Release --disable-build-servers tests/Nbn.Tests/Nbn.Tests.csproj --filter FullyQualifiedName~HiveMindTickBarrierTests --artifacts-path .artifacts-temp
  - Passed 17/17
- dotnet build -c Release --disable-build-servers
  - Succeeded (0 warnings, 0 errors)

Next runtime verification still needed (Workbench/demo):
1) Re-run local spawn flow with Workbench logging enabled.
2) Confirm that after any single drain-miss event, HiveMind does not enter repeated TickDeliver timeout streak leading to pause/disappear.
3) If drain-miss still occurs frequently, follow up with root-cause on why router stops receiving DrainInputs responses (IO reachability/registration freshness), separate from this mitigation.

comments.author: Hailey Collet
comments.text: Resolution summary (2026-02-26): spawn path is now stabilized and no longer failing with missing brain ID / assignment timeout under the tested local flow. Follow-up regressions have been split into dedicated issues: NBNv2-bje (visualizer/output-vector regressions) and NBNv2-776 (reproduction request failures). Additional hardening in this pass includes default HiveMind IO endpoint wiring (CLI + local launch), senderless visualization toggle support for Workbench, IO non-blocking repro/export forwarding, and output-coordinator width update propagation.

title: Implement Full-Brain Recovery on Shard/Node Loss
description: Add failure-recovery flow required by spec section 12.3: pause dispatch, unload affected brain runtime actors, restore from base `.nbn` + latest `.nbs`, then resume ticking.
acceptance_criteria: 1) Lost shard/worker events trigger recovery workflow automatically. 2) Recovery restores entire brain state from artifacts, not partial shard-only reconstruction. 3) Recovery telemetry and brain state transitions (Recovering->Active/Dead) are emitted.

title: Add Backpressure Pause Priority Strategies
description: Backpressure currently pauses all brains. Implement configured pause strategy selection (oldest-first, newest-first, lowest energy, lowest priority, externally ordered list) per spec section 6.5.
acceptance_criteria: 1) New config surface selects pause strategy. 2) Pause decision targets selected subset/order instead of unconditional PauseAllBrains. 3) Tests verify each strategy deterministically chooses expected brain(s).

title: Support Distributed IO Coordinators (Gateway-Aware Placement)
description: Align IO architecture with spec section 13.2 by allowing Input/Output coordinators to be hosted on worker nodes while IO Gateway routes to remote coordinator PIDs (instead of always spawning local coordinators).
acceptance_criteria: 1) IO registration protocol carries coordinator PID ownership/location. 2) IoGateway forwards to remote coordinator actors when assigned. 3) Spawn/placement/reassignment keep subscriptions and drain flow consistent across coordinator moves.

title: Implement ILGPU RegionShard Backend + CPU Parity
description: Add optional ILGPU compute backend (kernel-per-function model) with runtime selection/fallback to CPU and parity validation versus CPU backend per spec section 10.2.
acceptance_criteria: 1) GPU backend path exists with lazy kernel compilation/caching and explicit fallback. 2) Parity tests compare CPU vs GPU outputs/cost fields across representative functions. 3) Placement heuristics can prefer GPU-capable nodes when enabled.

title: Implement Real Worker Capability Probing and Benchmark Scores
description: Worker capabilities currently default to mostly zero values. Implement capability probing and optional micro-bench scoring for CPU/GPU/ILGPU availability to align with spec sections 9.2 and 10.3.
acceptance_criteria: 1) Heartbeats publish non-placeholder RAM/storage/GPU/ILGPU capability data when available. 2) CPU/GPU scores are computed or configured explicitly, not hardcoded zero. 3) SettingsMonitor inventory reflects updated capability fidelity.

title: Align Tick Cost Model With Function Weights + Remote Cost Knobs
description: Current cost accounting increments coarse counters and hardcodes remote cost to 0. Implement Appendix-B weighted function costs and configurable remote transport cost terms (`remote_cost_per_batch`, `remote_cost_per_contribution`).
acceptance_criteria: 1) Accum/activation/reset costs incorporate configured per-function/per-tier weights. 2) Remote batch/contribution costs can be toggled/configured and reported in `CostRemote`. 3) Tests validate expected cost deltas for representative function mixes and remote-delivery scenarios.

title: Complete Plasticity Policy Surface (Delta + Auto Rebase Thresholds)
description: Plasticity runtime supports enable/rate/probabilistic updates, but spec also requires distinct plasticity-delta behavior and threshold-triggered rebasing. Implement the missing config and runtime behavior, and document the resulting operator/runtime semantics.
acceptance_criteria: 1) Plasticity config supports distinct update-delta semantics consistent with the NBN spec (no doc downscope substitute). 2) Automatic rebase trigger supports changed-code count and percent thresholds with deterministic behavior. 3) Tests cover threshold-triggered rebase behavior and overlay reset semantics. 4) NBNv2_Design.md and operator-facing docs are updated to describe implemented plasticity/rebase controls and behavior.

title: Harden NBN/NBS Validation Invariants
description: Validation gaps remain in `NbnBinaryValidator`: destination span checks are bypassed, stride-zero can crash instead of returning a validation error, and reserved-field/ordering strictness is incomplete.
acceptance_criteria: 1) Axon target neuron IDs are validated against destination region span during `.nbn` validation. 2) Invalid stride produces structured validation errors (no divide-by-zero crash). 3) Reserved bytes/flags and required ordering rules are validated per spec.
close_reason: Closed
